resources.string: Choose an aircraft\nfrom list below or
file may be from older version, try deleting and re-creating
A sample file has been created. List will refresh.
Entry must be a decimal number (123.4)
The name of your W/B template will be your tail number plus the short description of the model of plane (i.e. N12345-c172). Enter the tail number and model below.
Choose how you will represent your weight and arm measurements below.

Enter the default weights and arms for your aircraft\'s Empty, Fuel, and Oil stats below. The empty and gross (maximum) weights can not be altered after the template is created. If you want to start at 0 for fuel / oil (or the oil weight is already part of your empty) then just leave the weight at 0 and it will not affect the final balance. (Hint: Most people set default full fuel and oil weights so they can divide by 2 for half fuel, etc)

Enter the name, arm and number of seats for each passenger row below (weights will be input when using the template later). Each row must have a unique name, and will be sorted by arm. Click + to add a row or - to remove the row.
Entry must be a positive integer above 0
Enter a unique name and arm for each baggage area (weight will be entered using the template later).
In this area you will enter data from your safe weight-to-moment envelope from the POH.
Most POHs have the moment divided by some number (usually 1000) for readability. Enter this number here to make the app\'s moment data match your POH references.
Weights should not be repeated. Interpolation requires several different weight points.
Warning: Duplicate low or high moment found. Most moment graphs slant, so duplicate moments are very rare. Please check your reference points.
Tail number or model blank. Both must be filled in.
Existing aircraft found with same name. Delete existing aircraft or change this name.
Weight or Arm units blank. Must select from available choices.
Empty Weight and Arm must be Numeric, and empty weight must be > 0
Gross weight must be Numeric and > the aircraft\'s empty weight.
Non-numeric entry: Empty, Fuel, and oil weights and arms must be numeric.
No Occupant rows found. This plane won\'t be very useful if it can\'t hold people.
Duplicate name found. Occupant rows must have unique names.
Found invalid number of seats. Each occupant row must have > 0 seats.
Duplicate name found: Baggage areas must have unique names.
Duplicate moment envelope weight found. At least 2 different weights are needed to interpolate.
Not enough moment envelope data. Must have at least two moment envelope data points for interpolation.
Low and High moment for given weight identical. Low and high moments must be separate for a safe envelope to exist.
High moment found less than low moment. It looks like the data was entered backwards.
